Loo Cheng Chuan, Founder at 1M65 MovementLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Nov 2018Before you decide on equity investment of any form, it is probably more useful to holistically look at your get rich plan.  this could mean :a. cover yourself adequately & affordably with a term insurance planb. set your financial safety net plan in motion (eg 1M65)c. map out savings vs expenditure limitsd financial targets e,g, savings / income e. then the return rates you need to reach your financial target (that's where your dividen investment startegy comes in).0 comments3

Yeap Ming FengLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 02 Nov 2018Hi,Great question. Before diving straight in, one can understand if dividend investing is for him in the first place. Since both value investing and dividend investing both exhibits their pros and cons, here's a checklist to see if dividend investing is suitable for you at the moment: https://blog.seedly.sg/dividend-growth-investing/To do dividend investing, the most common way is to look at REITs. Here's a compilation of all of them: https://blog.seedly.sg/review-reits-singapore-invest/Or you can look at high dividend stocks: https://blog.seedly.sg/beaten-down-shares-high-dividend-yield/0 comments1
